results.title: The Choice
results.brief_description: The staff of a high school newspaper decide to do an issue on the drug problem, by dividing into two groups to research the pros and cons of drug taking. Projects the message that before a choice is made in favour of the non-medical use of drugs one should be fully aware of the dangers to mental and physical health inherent in such a choice. Intended mainly for school children. NOTE: Restricted to tertiary institutions, teaching hospitals, police and customs departments.

results.title: The Choice
results.brief_description: Andy is an only child who must help his mother with the washing which is their livelihood. Other boys from more comfortable backgrounds harass Andy over his lack of material possessions and the situation arises where Andy’s closest friend is forced to choose between Andy and the other boys. Useful for analysis of values, decision making and social action.

results.title: The Choice
results.creator_credit: Millbank Films, Imperial Chemical Industries and Gordon Begg
results.brief_description: Surveys the results of pollution by all kinds of waste products in the natural environment: air, water and land, and discusses the counter-measures and better disposal methods being used. Stresses the need for industry, commerce, individuals and the community to be prepared to take action.

results.title: The Chipmunk adventure (Captioned)
results.brief_description: Join the high-flying adventures of Simon, Theodore and Alvin in their first full length feature movie. The fun begins when Dave leaves the Chipmunks behind when he goes to Europe. Alvin dreams of his own world travel and convinces his brothers to enter a hot air balloon race around the world against the Chipettes. As the two balloons compete for a $100,000 prize, they unwittingly assist a pair of international diamond smugglers. Alvin and the gang get more than their fair share of spills, thrills and excitement backed by a great rock soundtrack sung by the Chipmunks themselves.

results.title: The Chinese girl = La Chinoise
results.creator_credit: De La Gueville, Anouchka Films, Parc Film and Jean-Luc Godard
results.brief_description: This experimental non-linear work, about five students who embrace Maoism, heralded the second wave of Godard’s filmmaking - The Revolutionary. Spending the summer in the bourgeois surrounds of a borrowed flat, the students become immersed in the doctrine of Chairman Mao’s Little Red Book, discussing methodologies (which include terrorism and assassination) to overthrow governmental systems. Heralded by some as groundbreaking cinema that subverted popular notions of filmmaking (recall Godard’s famous quote: “A story should have a beginning, a middle and an end, but not necessarily in that order”), “La Chinoise” also confounded many Godard admirers with its obscure polemic. Cast includes: Juliet Berto, Jean-Pierre Leaud, Anne Wiazemsky and Blandine Jeanson.

results.title: The Chinese connection = Fist of fury
results.creator_credit: National General Pictures, Raymond Chow and Lo Wei
results.brief_description: This martial arts action film stars Bruce Lee as Chen Chen, returning to his former school in early 20th Century Shanghai to learn that his beloved teacher has been murdered. While probing the man’s death and seeking vengeance, Chen discovers that a drug smuggling operation, a rival school, and simmering racial tensions between Chinese and Japanese locals are factors in the nefarious dealings at his school and in his master’s murder. Poorly dubbed into English. Cast includes: Bruce Lee, Robert Baker, Miao Ker Hsiu.

results.title: The Chinese bungalow
results.creator_credit: British Lion Film Corp and George King
results.brief_description: Based on the Matheson Lang and Marion Osmond stage drama about a Chinese merchant who plots to kill the lover of his English wife. Stars Paul Lukas, Jane Baxter, Robert Douglas, Kay Walsh, Wallace Douglas, Jerry Verno. Photography by Hone Glendinning. Music by Jack Beaver. Edited by Jack Harris. Art direction by Philip Bawcombe.

results.title: The China syndrome
results.creator_credit: Columbia Pictures, Michael Douglas and James Bridges
results.brief_description: An explosive contemporary thriller starring Jane Fonda, Jack Lemmon and Michael Douglas. Fonda is cast as a news reporter who covers a story on nuclear energy and films a startling and controversial ‘incident’. Lemmon is a veteran engineer whose integrity makes him a target for murder. Douglas is a newsreel cameraman determined to discover what his film footage, which the station refuses to air, really means. The China Syndrome is acknowledged as one of the best made films dealing with such highly controversial subject matter.

results.title: The Chimes
results.brief_description: Toby Veck (Trotty) is a poverty stricken ticker seller in the 1840’s who comes to life when he is on a job. His constant companion through good times and bad is the chimes that peal their lovely noise, seemingly just for Toby, and speak to him in times of need. One New Years Eve, the night before his daughter, Meg’s wedding, Toby is entrusted with a letter from the alderman that puts him in bad spirits and forces him to question his place in such a world. After coming to the aid of another man and his young child, Toby dreams a frightful dream that night, but the faithful chimes clear his mind and his faith in humanity is restored. This claymation film is based on a story by Charles Dickens.
